text: Welcome to CLUE! CLUE is a shared environment where you and your peers can collaboratively design STEM solutions. CLUE supports the creation and sharing of graphs, text, images, drawings, mathematical models, sensor-based coding, and more. This first activity will introduce you to CLUE tools for problem-solving and give you opportunities to try things out on your own.

Your workspaces (and this content) are made of little chunks called tiles. Whenever you choose a tool from the toolbar on the left side of your workspace, you will get a tile with that tool in it. Tools let express your ideas in different ways:

  • text
  • tables
  • sketches
  • data cards
  • graphs
  • equations
  • programs

Try hovering your mouse over the text or other tiles in this tab. Youâ€™ll see a gray box around each tool tile.

On the right is your workspace. To solve problems in your workspace, you add tool tiles. You can get a tile in your workspace by

  • dragging a tile from the problem or any other workspace on the left pane (Resources) into your workspace on the right.
  • or clicking or dragging a new (empty) tile tool from the menu of tools on the left of your workspace.

All tiles have a waffle (gray triangle with six dots) in the upper right corner if you hover over it. To arrange a tile, click the waffle and hold it down as you drag it into place. As you drag the tile into the workspace, a fat blue line shows where the tile will go when you let go.

You can also select tiles and copy them y into your workspace using the tools on the far left of this pane.

tiles.title: Copy Tools to select everything and move it into your workspace

text: Drag or create the tiles that you need to help you into the your workspace. Drag them around to arrange them as you like. Once a tile is in your workspace, you can edit it, use it's special tools, delete it, or move it around.

Collaborate in Groups

In CLUE, everyone works in groups. When you start an activity, you get into a group randomly. You can change groups by clicking on the group number in the upper right corner to swap groups. When you change groups, your work moves with you.

Groups are important in CLUE. You can learn from classmates in your group and they can learn from you both by discussing solutions while you observe each other, and by copying parts of each other's work to extend them. Groups also let you catch up on work if you missed a day. You can also share work with any member of the class if they have shared in the Class Work tab.
Alright! You're all warmed up. Now go on to the Exercise tab to try out the STEM tools available in CLUE.
